header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: Mrs Nana, who is with you?
Thank you Mr Chairperson.  Your story Ma'am, in front of us, I would like you briefly to give us a clear picture of what happened to Desmond Nana on that day. Please come nearer to the microphone.
It was at about half past six, we heard that Desmond Nana was shot by Macebo Ndinisa in the township.
One young man came asking whether we knew them.  I said yes, he was my son.
Was he a member of any political organisation?
He was a member of the ANC.
At the time of this incident, what was happening in the township, was there a consumer boycott?
There was a toyi-toyi in the township.
The municipality police were the ones who were disrupting the people who were in the struggle?
This Kits Constable is he Macebo Ndinisa?
Between your family and Ndinisa's family, was there a conflict?
He shot your son because he was against Kits Constables?
Would you like to add something my sister?
Yes, I do.  He told my brother to give him a passport.  My brother told him that he left his passport at home, that is when he shot at him.
That was the reason for the shooting?
Yes, he shot him because of that.
Did Desmond have a wife at that time?
No, he did not have a wife.
He was working at the time.
What would you like Ma'am, what would you like the Commission to do for you?
There is nobody supporting me.  There is nobody working for me.  I am just staying with my children.  There is no one at home.
Do you get an old age grant?
Were you affected, how was your health affected by this?
My left arm is not working properly.  I got injured at work, I was working in the bakery.

I have two children.  This one and a young boy.  My young boy is still at school.   This one is not attending school because I don't have money.  She completed standard 10, my young boy is doing standard 2.
Those are your requests you would like us to forward to the President of this country?
Thank you Ma'am.  Let me now go to Mr Godana.  What is your clan name sir?
Please tell us briefly sir what happened to you so that we can find out what the condition was at that time.

I am here today.  I have a brother by the name of Joseph Mzingaye Godana.  He was working in the mine.  He came back home, he stayed for two weeks.  There was a toyi-toyi then.  Two people came.  He was working in the yard at home.
 These people said that the crowd was looking for you, he said I am busy working.  They ten came to the yard to take him.  They gave him five litre petrol.
Was your brother a member of any organisation?

No, he was working in Johannesburg, he was not a member of an organisation.  He just arrived from Johannesburg.  He was not a member in the township.
 Everybody was supposed to go with the crowd.
Were these people members of any organisation?

They were the people who were toyi-toying.  He was taken by the people who was toyi-toying.  They were going to Cenyu in Vusumzi Kula's home.  Alcohol was banned in the township.  Vusumzi had a sjibeen.
 These people were going there to burn down his sjibeen.  They found Dlomba there.  Dlomba in the sjibeen.
When he saw them, he pulled out his gun and he shot at them.  He shot three of them and others ran away.
The speaker's microphone is not on.
He was shot, that happened at about eleven o'clock.  He got help at about three o'clock.  He was shot by Dlomba in the head.  They were going towards the sjibeen.
Was there a case against Dlomba?  Was there a case against Dlomba?  I don't know whether Dlomba is his surname or his name.
Was there a case against him?  You said that Dlomba is the one who shot your brother, was he charged of anything?
No, he was not charged.  It is the first time that this thing comes to public.
Did you go to any Attorney?
No, I did not go to any Attorney.
Did you go to report this matter to the police?
The police showed me my brother in the mortuary.  I saw my brother, I saw the bullet hole in his head.  We then buried him.
Did you get a death certificate?
Who was the Doctor?  Who was the Doctor who signed the death certificate?
I got the death certificate in the police certificate, I did not get it from the Doctor.  He was not taken to a Doctor.
Did your brother have a wife?
No, he did not have a wife.
What would you like the Commission to forward to the President of this country?
I would like to be helped to build a house and to get money from where he was working in Johannesburg.
He did not get anything from his work?
Did you get any letters from them?
Do you still have his ID?
His ID is in the police station.

We have to get the documents so that you can be helped to get his pension money from Johannesburg.
 What else is your request?
The government will see what to do for me.
You mentioned Creches at Bethel Mission?
It is a house for me to stay and my children.
You will say that the creche is the house where you and your children are staying?
I thought that you wanted this creche for the young children?
We will forward your request to the President of this country.  For now, let me hand over to my Chairperson.  Maybe he's got questions for you.

Vuyswa can answer if it is better, I don't mind.  Vuyswa you told us that a civil claim was instituted on this case.  I am not sure if I missed it when you were being asked questions earlier.
 But can you tell us the name of the Attorney who instituted that case?

The case was opened in the police station, it was never taken to an Attorney.  Mr Dunkin Qacqa said that he was going to consult an ANC Attorney.  It was the last time we heard about it.  We then went to the police station to open a case, but the case did not go any further.

And the second question relates to what has been said here about other children being involved in the incident, that was shot at by the same perpetrator.
 Who are those children?  Do you know them, were they Dyonasi Peter and Nomathemba?

It was not Dyonasi Peter.  Peter was the one who reported this incident at home.  He said that my brother was near Nomathemba's home.  The person who was shot was Bongani Calmache and he died.  I don't remember others.
Thank you very much, thank you.

We thank you ladies and gentlemen.   We have noted your requests.  Our job is to collect all the information and the requests so that we can forward them to the President of this country in Pretoria.
 He will be the one who will see what to do for you.  It is not upon us to decide.  If you see us around, don't ask us where is my house, the one I wanted in the Commission.  It is not upon us to decide, it is the President who is going to decide what to do.  We just gather information and we compile a report, forward it to the President so that he can see that he will build a house for certain people, he will see how to compensate you because this incidents happened all over the country, it did not only happen in Stutterheim or in the Eastern Cape, but it happened through the whole country.
 But we promise you that we've listened to what you have said.  When we are compiling our report, they will be included in our report.  Those in authority will see what to do.
 For now we thank you, you my go back to your seats, thank you.

I represent Mr Dlomba in respect of the incident just previously testified to.  Quite obviously we have not taken full instructions and therefor  our response has to be the same as has been all day, in respect of the other incidents.
 However, we are informed that there indeed was an inquest.
We are just trying to get our documents, which number is it?
It is a specific reference to the witness Godana, number 1717, if my memory serves me correct, number 11 on your list if I am not mistaken.
Yes.  It is in respect of that.
It is witness number 11 on your list.
Okay, we are on the same page now, thank you.  Mr Redpath, you are representing Mr Dlomba?

Correct.  You will recall Mr Godana made reference to the home of a Mr Vusumzi Kula, who is another one of the persons whom I represent.
 Vusumzi Kula is the person implicated by the old lady, Zamkana and there is a second witness who is not present today, who also had a complaint against Vusumzi Kula, it is one Xhalisile.  These incidents are all fairly closely tied together.
 In respect of the evidence given by Mr Godana, at this stage I can inform the Commission there was an inquest.  I just don't know the outcome of the inquest, I just don't have any documentation, but as before, we pledge our full cooperation, we will not be obstructive in any way.
 We simply require time to prepare and present a fair case on behalf of those implicated.  Thank you Mr Chairman.

Thank you Mr Redpath.  The toyi-toyi was going to
Vusumzi Kula's house?
The toyi-toyi was going to Vusumzi Kula's and the alleged perpetrator in this case, Mr Dlomba, then  the allegation is that he shot at the people who were toyi-toying to this house?
That is my basic understanding at this stage, yes.
Okay.  And you are saying that there was an inquest.
I am informed that there was, yes.
And you would assist us with the inquest records if you get them before we do?
Thank you very much.  Thank you Mr Redpath.
